intro: Fimbristylis recta, commonly known as the narrowleaf spikerush, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with slender, cylindrical stems and small, spike-like clusters of flowers. Fimbristylis recta typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of water bodies. It plays an important role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and stabilizing soil.
